memberdef.argsstring: (const cv::Mat &image, const geo::Vec2i &p, int d_start, std::vector< geo::Vec2i > &points, std::vector< geo::Vec2i > &line_starts, cv::Mat &contour_map, bool add_first)
memberdef.name: findContours

briefdescription.para: find the countours in an image

parameterdescription.para: image in which to find the image
point from which to start the search
direction in which to start the search (0=right, 1=down, 2=left, 3=up) wraps above 3.
vector of 2d points corresponding to the contour points in pixel coordinates.
a set of 2d points in which the contour travels up. used to check for holes later.
a map in which pixels belonging to the contour have value 1
wether the first point should be added immediately. if false the algorithm will determine which point to add first.

briefdescription.para: convert a pixel in the map image into coordinates in the map frame. (Note, this function assumes the pixel belongs to an image with a 1 pixel border w.r.t the original image)

parameterdescription.para: the point in pixel coordinates. with (row=0, col=0) in the top left corner of the image.
resolution of the map in meters per pixel
amount of rows the image has, or the 'height' in pixels

simplesect.para: vector of the pose corresponding to the bottom left corner of the pixel. with coordinates (0,0) in the bottom left of the image.
